about.intro: I have a bachelor's in computer engineering from St. Cloud State University (SCSU) and currently work at 3M as an Application Analyst. I spend my free time doing variety of things like firmware and application development, PCB design, fishing, cooking, problem solving, etc. I am always on the look out for a new challenge and enjoy occasional drinks at the local bar.

projects.title: Trackable Gadget for Virtual Reality
projects.projectDesc: Senior Design Project during my undergrad at SCSU. The gadget can interface with the HTC Vive Lighthouse and convert the IR light signals into patterns that can be converted in to angles. With a very clever posititioning algorithm, the trackable gadget providea the neccessary information to be positioned related to the Lighthouse. My main contribution to the project was hardware design consisting of a transimpedance amplifier and PCB design and assembly.

projects.title: Function Generator and Pulse Measurement
projects.projectDesc: Designed and implemented a square-wave function generator and pulse measurer in C utilizing a PIC16F4455-I/PT. The data is transmitted over bluetooth (RN-42 rs232) and visualized with a C# Visual Studio Forms Application.

projects.title: Amplitude Shift Key (ASK) Communication System
projects.projectDesc: Designed and implemented an electrical system that consisted of a transmitter and receiver of a data signal. The system operates with a carrier frequency of about 125 kHz, the bandwidth was limited to the op amps supplied.

projects.title: Nerdboard
projects.projectDesc: Interactive online whiteboard to brainstorm, do homework, or just doddle!

projects.title: Slices of the 4th Dimension!
projects.projectDesc: This app plots any 3D cross section of a 4D object. On the left is the fimilar concept of the Conic Sections, and on the right is the plot of the 3D cross section.

projects.title: Find a number of length n in the Fibonacci Sequence
projects.projectDesc: Find a number of length 'n' from the Fibonacci Sequence, the app was inspired by a question hosted on ProjectEuler.net.
